text: Begum Kulsoom Nawaz Sharif (Urdu: بیگم كلثوم نواز شريف) (29 March 1948 – 11 September 2018) was a Pakistani politician. She was the First Lady of Pakistan three times; from 1990 to 1993, 1997 to 1999 and then from 2013 to 2017. Kulsoom served as the President of Pakistan Muslim League-N (PML-N) from 1999 to 2002. Nawaz was diagnosed with lymphoma in August 2017 and died in September 2018 at the age of 70. ==References== Category:First Ladies Category:Politicians from Lahore Category:1950 births Category:2018 deaths
title: Kulsoom Nawaz
